title: Google Sheets COUNTA Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google Sheets COUNTA Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets COUNTA Function

COUNTA Function
The
COUNTA
function is a premade function in Google Sheets
content_sections.content: , which counts cells that has values, both letters and numbers.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=COUNTA
and gets a list of cells:
=COUNTA(
value1
,
[value2, ...]
)
You can
select cells one by one, but also ranges, or even multiple ranges.

content_sections.title: Apply the
content_sections.content:
=COUNTA
function to range
D2:D21
. Counting Pokemons by their names, which are letters only:
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting		305
    Poliwrath	Water	Fighting	510
    Victreebel	Grass	Poison	490
    Tentacool	Water	Poison	335
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465
    Dewgong	Water	Ice	475
    Cloyster	Water	Ice	525
    Onix	Rock	Ground	385
    Dragonair	Dragon		420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349
    Rattata	Normal		253
    Beedrill	Bug	Poison	395
    Doduo	Normal	Flying	310
    Kingler	Water		475
    Nidoqueen	Poison	Ground	505
    Hitmonchan	Fighting		455
    Charmeleon	Fire		405
    Arbok	Poison		438
    Gastly	Ghost	Poison	310
    Magikarp	Water		200
Copy Values
COUNTA
function, step by step:
Select the cell
A22

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=COUNTA
Click the
COUNTA
command
Specify range
A2:A21
Hit enter
That's it! The
=COUNTA
function successfully counted 20 cells with values in the range
A2:A21
.
Another Example (Numbers)

content_sections.title: Apply the
content_sections.content:
=COUNTA
function to the range
D2:D21
, which only has cells with numbers.
That is great!
The
COUNTA
function counts cells in a range with values both numbers and letters.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Google Sheets COUNTA Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google Sheets COUNTA Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google Sheets COUNTA Function and how to apply it in your projects.
